tab_content.accordion_title: Can I talk to a doctor on Maple about my atopic dermatitis?
tab_content.accordion_intro: Yes. In most cases, a doctor on Maple can treat atopic dermatitis online by asking about your symptoms and by taking a look at your skin through a photo or by video. Once you describe your symptoms to the doctor, they’ll be able to provide a diagnosis, write necessary prescriptions, and recommend an appropriate course of treatment. If the doctor suspects you have a more serious problem, they may suggest for you to go to a clinic for a thorough physical examination.
tab_content.accordion_content: In select provinces, you can also request to see a dermatologist right on Maple about your atopic dermatitis. To learn more about how our online dermatology assessments work, please click here.

tab_content.accordion_title: Can I get a prescription on Maple?
tab_content.accordion_intro: Yes, our physicians can prescribe medications online during your consultation. Once you accept a prescription, you’ll have the option to pick it up from any pharmacy or to have it delivered right to your door at no additional cost.
tab_content.accordion_content: You can visit our How it Works page to learn more.

tab_content.accordion_intro:
Dermatitis is a group of diseases resulting in the inflammation of the skin. It can cause the skin to darken, develop rough or scaly patches, swell, crust, and ooze.

Atopic dermatitis is a chronic form of dermatitis which causes the skin to become red and itchy. It usually begins in childhood and can improve or worsen over time.

tab_content.accordion_title: What are the symptoms of atopic dermatitis?
tab_content.accordion_intro:
Symptoms of atopic dermatitis include:

  • Itchy skin
  • Dry or cracked skin
  • Red patches
  • Swollen skin

tab_content.accordion_title: How can I treat atopic dermatitis?
tab_content.accordion_intro: In some cases, atopic dermatitis can go away on its own, especially when contracted at a young age. Otherwise, medications like steroid creams, oral immune therapies or targeted biological therapies can help control inflation, cracking, and itching of the skin.

With Maple, you can start talking to a doctor about your symptoms in a matter of minutes. We’re a healthcare app for fast, convenient 24/7 access to Canadian doctors.

You simply log in, tap a button to request a consultation, and we’ll immediately connect you to a doctor via live chat or video. You can visit our How it Works page to learn more.

Our doctors can assess symptoms, and provide treatment, including prescriptions as necessary.
tab_content.accordion_content: Additionally, for select provinces, you may see a dermatologist on Maple about your atopic dermatitis the same way you would request a consultation with a general practitioner. Maple’s dermatologists are able to provide you with a diagnosis, necessary notes, treatment plans, and prescriptions within 24 hours.
